intro: Andira inermis, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or pink trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and usually elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Andira inermis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
